TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IList implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
type IList = interface interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a non-generic collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Collections.IList> is a descendant of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface and is the base interface of all non-generic lists. <xref:System.Collections.IList> implementations fall into three categories: read-only, fixed-size, and variable-size. A read-only <xref:System.Collections.IList> cannot be modified. A fixed-size <xref:System.Collections.IList> does not allow the addition or removal of elements, but it allows the modification of existing elements. A variable-size <xref:System.Collections.IList> allows the addition, removal, and modification of elements.
For the generic version of this interface, see <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list.
[!code-csharp[System.Collections.IList_Implementation#01](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.IList_Implementation/cs/Program.cs#01)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.IList_Implementation#01](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.IList_Implementation/vb/Program.vb#01)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implementations of this method can vary in how they handle the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the capacity of a collection. Typically, the count is set to zero, and references to other objects from elements of the collection are also released. The capacity can be set to zero or a default value, or it can remain unchanged.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the contains a specific value.
Docs.returns: if the is found in the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, this method uses the collection's objects' <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods on `item` to determine whether item exists. In the earlier versions of the .NET Framework, this determination was made by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods of the `item` parameter on the objects in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, object value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Insert(int32 index, object value) cil managed
Public Sub Insert (index As Integer, value As Object)
public: void Insert(int index, System::Object ^ value);
abstract member Insert : int * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which should be inserted.
The object to insert into the .
Docs.summary: Inserts an item to the at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `index` equals the number of items in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>, then `value` is appended to the end.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element. If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

Docs.value: if the has a fixed size; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

Default Public Property Item(index As Integer) As Object

member this.Item(int) : obj with get, set

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
Docs.value: The element at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`.
The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Item%2A> property. Visual Basic implements <xref:System.Collections.IList.Item%2A> as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

The property is set and the is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove(object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to remove from the .
Docs.summary: Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table. If `value` is not found in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>, the <xref:System.Collections.IList> remains unchanged and no exception is thrown.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to create a simple list, fixed-size list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
